definition: one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
to (a place)/until (a time)/up to/to go/to arrive/(verb complement denoting completion or result of an action)

sentences.english: Jiang Wen was a pretty girl who had a big smile right through the day.
sentences.chinese: 記憶中的蔣雯是個一天到晚笑盈盈的美麗姑娘。

sentences.english: I just didn't have debt collectors calling me at all hours of the day, that's all.
sentences.chinese: 只不過那些追債的人沒有一天到晚的催我，就這樣。

sentences.english: These words, is that hardworking people do all day long heart line.
sentences.chinese: 這幾句話，是說用功人一天到晚心行上的事。

sentences.english: Just look down your garbage bin, and you know what these people deal with on a daily basis.
sentences.chinese: 你就會懷疑這羣人一天到晚看着這玩意怎麼喫得下飯？

sentences.english: I'm tired of the noise maked by him night and day.
sentences.chinese: 我對他一天到晚製造噪音已經感到很厭煩了。

sentences.english: All day long I can hear people talking out loud.
sentences.chinese: 一天到晚我總聽到人聲嘈雜。

sentences.english: My little nephew sticks to his mom twenty-four seven.
sentences.chinese: 我的小外甥一天到晚都黏著他媽媽。

sentences.english: Look at your straight face, do I owe you some money or did someone die in your family?
sentences.chinese: 你一天到晚板着臉，是我欠你錢還是你家裏頭死人了？

sentences.english: Tom's wife nags at him all day.
sentences.chinese: 湯姆的妻子一天到晚跟他嘮叨不止。

sentences.english: He's always pestering me for money.
sentences.chinese: 他一天到晚纏着我要錢。

sentences.english: I hope they 'll become friends and not to fight all the time .
sentences.chinese: 我希望它們會成爲好朋友，不要一天到晚打來打去。

sentences.english: I hope they'll become friends and not to fight all the time.
sentences.chinese: 我希望它們會成爲好朋友，不要一天到晚打來打去。

sentences.english: What’s more, you’re likely to get very tired of eating cookies day in and day out.
sentences.chinese: 還有什麼，你可能對一天到晚喫餅乾感到厭倦。

sentences.english: And we can do this all day long.
sentences.chinese: 我們可以一天到晚都做這個事。

sentences.english: The telephone exchange has been jammed all day with people wanting to buy season tickets.
sentences.chinese: 很多人想買季票，電話總機一天到晚忙個不停。

sentences.english: Watch TV, advertising screams at you all day long.
sentences.chinese: 看電視時，廣告一天到晚地向你“怪叫”。

definition: lit. twice every three days (idiom); practically every day/frequently
to have nothing to do/to idle one's time away (idiom)
day and night/regardless of the time of day or night
not to engage in honest work/to ignore one's proper occupation/not to attend to one's proper duties
to tire oneself out through overwork/to work oneself to death
to putter around/to work to no avail
to live as a parasite/doing nothing to earn one's keep
